stimulusHtml: Is there a value of a,−4≤a<6 , for which the Mean Value Theorem, applied to the interval [a, 6], guarantees a value c, a<c<6, at which  f ′ ( c )= 1 3 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C67@ ? Justify your answer.

features.html: A continuous function f is defined on the closed interval − 4 ≤ x ≤ 6 . The graph of f consists of a line segment and a curve that is tangent to the x -axis at x =3, as shown in the figure above. On the interval 0< x <6, the function f is twice differentiable, with f ''( x )>0.
